715215f-a.title: Manhattan: 120th Street (East) - 3rd Avenue
715215f-a.text:
180-172 East 120th Street, at, adioining, and west of the S.W.
corner of Third Avenue. No. 180-176 are frame houses.
July 24, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

722928f-b.title: Manhattan: 120th Street (West) - 3rd Avenue
722928f-b.text:
Riverside Park: A set of 2 views northward from a point near West
120th Street. Above the shrubs on the left appears the Tomb of General
Ulysses S. Grant overlooking the Hudson River. Upon the latter is a
ferry boat just putting into the slip at West 125th Street. Shown in
view No. 2 is the New York Central Railroad paralleling the waters edge.
Today, (1938) the tracks have disappeared, having been covered over
during the West Side Improvement, for an account of same, see, booklet
published by the Department of Parks on the opening ocoasion October
12, 1937.
June 1, 1911.
W. L. Bogert.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

722928f-a.title: Manhattan: 120th Street (West) - 3rd Avenue

722927f-a.title: Manhattan: 120th Street (West) - 3rd Avenue
722927f-a.text:
Riverside Park: Two westward views towards the Hudson River with
the U.S. Fleet thereon. Photographers vantage point is near West 120th
Street.
June 28, 1919.
Walter L. Bogert.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

708152f-b.title: Manhattan: 3rd Avenue - 120th Street
708152f-b.text:
(1)
2196, 2198 Third Avenue at S.W. corner of 120th Street.
July 25, 1932.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, two years later.
July 19, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NsO REPRODUCTIONS.

708154f-a.title: Manhattan: 3rd Avenue - 120th Street
708154f-a.text:
Third Avenue, west side, south from 120th Street, showing 2198-
S196 Third Avenue, on the S. W. corner of 120th Street, two
three-story frame houses.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection,Museum of the City of New York,
Negative No. 261,
CREDIT LINE IPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.
